PRU - Getting Started with R/RStudio Ecosystem Welcome

PRU - Getting Started with R/RStudio Ecosystem RQ & PRU 2021-02-16 Welcome This booklet is produced in parallel to the joint hacking sessions and serves as an aide memoire. Each (learning) journey starts with the first steps. And learning R, RStudio, the many useful R packages combine for a universe that is impossible to explore in a single go. Thus, the goal is to get you started and give you some orientation on how to navigate this universe. The booklet is not an invention of me. It uses the feedback from several runs of “intro to R” sessions. And it lives from the feedback, observations, and many ahas we had while hacking and learning together. If you find this resource useful, feel free to reuse it at your own risk!

Chapter 6 Fragments The following comprises a few things that have been moved here from the template and/or tackled in side discussions. This section will be cleaned over time or forms the basis for advanced chapters. For the time being it is safe to ignore them. 6.1 Bookdown The engine behind this booklet is bookdown. The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.name/tinytex/.
